publication.title: MSRA Columbus at GeoCLEF 2006
publication.keyword: Automatic Query Expansion;Geographic Information Retrieval;Indexation;Natural Language;Query Expansion;Search Engine;Text Indexing;Cross Language Evaluation Forum;Rule Based;
publication.abstract: This paper describes the participation of Columbus Project of Microsoft Research Asia (MSRA) in the Geo- CLEF 2006 (a cross-language geographical retrieval track which is part of Cross Language Evaluation Forum). For location extraction from the corpus, we employ a gazetteer and rule based approach. We use the MSRA's IREngine as our text search engine. Both text indexing and geo-indexing

publication.title: Exploring LDA-Based Document Model for Geographic Information Retrieval
Indexing implicit locations for geographical information retrieval
publication.keyword: Geographic Information;Geographic Information Retrieval;Indexation;Information Retrieval;Cross Language Evaluation Forum;Local Search;
publication.abstract: Local search has become a hot topic recently in information retrieval research area. How to retrieve geographical information correctly and efficiently is a key challenge to location-based search services. In this paper, we present a GIR (geographical information retrieval) system which uses implicit locations to improve retrieval performance. Experimental results based on Geo-CLEF 2006 (a cross-language geographical retrieval track which

publication.title: Mining geographic knowledge using location aware topic model
publication.abstract: Most online activities are associated with geographical locations. For example, people write personal blogs about interesting places they have ever been to; read news about important local events; and search the web to find delicious restaurants. Mining geographical knowledge from these online activities can greatly benefit lots of web applications. In this paper, we propose a Location Aware Topic Model

publication.title: Robust Visual Tracking Via Incremental Maximum Margin Criterion
MusicSense: contextual music recommendation using emotional allocation modeling
publication.abstract: In this paper, we present a novel contextual music recom- mendation approach, MusicSense, to automatically suggest music when users read Web documents such as Weblogs. MusicSense matches music to a document's content, in terms of the emotions expressed by both the document and the mu- sic songs. To achieve this, we propose a generative model- Emotional Allocation Modeling-in which a

publication.title: Collapse-to-zoom: viewing web pages on small screen devices by interactively removing irrelevant content
publication.keyword: Marking Menu;Small Screen Device;Web Browsing;Web Pages;
publication.abstract: Overview visualizations for small-screen web browsers were designed to provide users with visual context and to allow them to rapidly zoom in on tiles of relevant content. Given that content in the overview is reduced, however, users are often unable to tell which tiles hold the relevant material, which can force them to adopt a time-consuming hunt-and-peck strategy. Collapse-to-zoom addresses

publication.title: An adaptive web page layout structure for small devices
publication.keyword: Adaptive Content Delivery;Branch and Bound Algorithm;Document Representation;Dynamic Adaptation;Information Access;Information Acquisition;Mobile Device;User Study;Web Browsing;Web Pages;
publication.abstract: The limited display size of current small Inter- net devices is becoming a serious obstacle to information access. In this paper, we introduce a Document REpresen- tation for Scalable Structures (DRESS) to help informa- tion providers make composite documents, typically web pages, scalable in both logic and layout structure to sup- port effective information acquisition in heterogeneous en- vironments. Through

publication.title: Off-line Chinese signature verification based on support vector machines
publication.abstract: This paper proposes a novel off-line Chinese signature verification method based on support vector machines. The method uses both static features and dynamic features. The static features include moment features and 16-direction distribution (an improvement on 4-direction distribution). The dynamic features include gray distribution and stroke width distribution. At last, support vector machine is used to classify the signatures. The

publication.title: Links between PPCA and subspace methods for complete Gaussian density estimation
publication.keyword: Covariance Matrix;Density Estimation;High Dimensionality;Indexing Terms;Machine Learning;Pattern Recognition;Robust Estimator;Subspace Method;Probabilistic Principal Component Analysis;
publication.abstract: Abstract, High-dimensional density estimation is a fundamental problem in pattern recognition and machine learning areas. In this letter, we show that, for complete high-dimensional Gaussian density estimation, two widely used methods, probabilistic principal component analysis and a typical subspace method using eigenspace decomposition, actually give the same results. Additionally, we present a unified view from the aspect of robust estimation

publication.title: A Metamodel for Enabling a Service Oriented Architecture
publication.keyword: Data Model;Process Model;Process Modelling;Reusable Component;Service Oriented Architecture;Web Service;
publication.abstract: Process modelling initiatives generally develop their process models without much emphasis on data, burying their sequence of operations as a thread within a non-elementary process. More often than not, these buried operations are elementary atomic reusable components. The resulting models are generally not flexible or sufficiently reusable, suffering from update anomalies and redundancies. Addressing "service" as a major deliverable component,
